movies.title: Terror
movies.plot: Royal descendants feel the wrath of the curse of condemned witch Mad Dolly, who spews forth her prophecy while she is burned at the stake. The victims suffer death by having their heads removed in various fashions, getting their limbs caught in animal traps, knife wounds, and other methods of medieval torture.
movies.simplePlot: Royal descendants feel the wrath of the curse of condemned witch Mad Dolly, who spews forth her prophecy while she is burned at the stake. The victims suffer death by having their heads ...

biography.bio: John Nolan was born on May 22, 1938 in London, England. He is an actor, known for Batman Begins (2005), The Dark Knight Rises (2012) and Following (1998). He has been married to Kim Hartman since 1975. They have two children.
biography.name: John Nolan

biography.bio: Carolyn Courage is an actress, known for Terror (1978), Buccaneer (1980) and Love and Mr Lewisham (1972).
biography.name: Carolyn Courage

biography.placeOfBirth: Klagenfurt, Carinthia, Austria [now Klagenfurt am Wörthersee, Carinthia, Austria]
biography.bio: James Aubrey was born on August 28, 1947 in Klagenfurt, Carinthia, Austria as James Aubrey Tregidgo. He was an actor and casting director, known for Lord of the Flies (1963), Spy game - Jeu d'espions (2001) and The Hunger (1983). He was married to Agnes Kristin Hallander. He died on April 6, 2010 in Cranwell, Lincolnshire, England.
biography.name: James Aubrey

biography.bio: Sarah Keller is an actress, known for A Kiss Before Dying (1991), Terror (1978) and The Princess Stallion (1997). She has been married to Richard Walsh since 1976. They have one child.
biography.name: Sarah Keller

biography.bio: Tricia Walsh's (aka, Tricia Walsh-Smith) father was in the Royal Air Force, so as a child, she traveled the world. In her teens, she went to London and studied at the Italia Conti Academy of Dramatic Arts. She appeared in television situation comedies, The Kenny Everett Show, Constant Hot water, Dick Emery Show, Grange Hill, The Six O'Clock Show, Biggins History of the World and other Bits, and television plays such as the award winning, _The Best Years of Your Life (1986) BBC. As herself she has appeared on Inside Edition, at least fifteen apppearances on ET's The Insider, Extra, On the Record with Greta Van Susteren, and Geraldo. Movies include the cult hit, "Terror," (1978). She has also appeared in over five hundred television commercials. Also a playwright, plays include, "Bonkers", which premiered at the Man in the Moon theater, London, with a national UK tour following, and "The Thong". Her play "Addiction's" was to have it's world premiere at the Yvonne Arnaud Theatre, Guildford, UK, in 2004 but was mysteriously cancelled. The same happened with her drama, "The Last Journey," set to open at Westport Country Playhouse, May 17th, 2008. It was "postponed," supposedly until the 2009 season. It still hasn't happened. (Could he ex-husband, the Chairman of the powerful Shubert Organization be responsible . . .?) She has recently completed a musical. "Arm Candy," and has performed some of the songs in London nightclubs. Her music will also be heavily featured in Sky 1's seven part documentary, "Pineapple The Dance Studio: Survival of the Fittest," which followed Tricia while she was in London. The series premieres in February 2010.
biography.name: Tricia Walsh

biography.bio: Glynis Barber was born on October 25, 1955 in South Africa as Glynis van der Riet. She is an actress, known for EastEnders (1985), Dempsey and Makepeace (1985) and Point Break (2015). She has been married to Michael Brandon since November 18, 1989. They have one child. She was previously married to Paul Antony-Barber.
biography.name: Glynis Barber

biography.bio: Michael Craze was born on 29 November 1942 in Cornwall and got into acting quite by chance as, at the age of twelve, he discovered through Boy Scout Gang Shows that he had a perfect boy soprano voice. This led him to win parts in "The King and I" and "Plain and Fancy", both at Drury Lane, and "Damn Yankees" at the Coliseum. Once he had left school, he went into repertory and got into TV through his agent. His first televison was a show called "Family Solicitor" for Granada which was followed for Granada which was followed, amongst others, by a part in ABC TV's 1960 series "Target Luna" (written by Malcolm Hulke and Eric Price and produced by Sydney Newman). When he was twenty Michael wrote, directed and acted in a film called "The Golden Head" which won an award at the Commonwealth Film Festival in Cardiff. Following Doctor Who, Michael worked on several ITV productions, including one episode (The Last Visitor) of Hammer Films' first TV series "Journey to the Unknown" in 1968. In the eighties Michael acted only occasionally and also managed a pub.
biography.name: Michael Craze

biography.bio: Rosie Collins, also known as Rose Collins, is a British actress. Collins played Amanda in two episodes of Dixon of Dock Green (1972-1974), she played Rosie in eight episodes of Justice in 1974. She appeared in one episode of Crossroads in 1975, and also appeared in the Norman J. Warren horror film Terror in 1978. Collins went on to play Prudence in five episodes of the series The Incredible Mr Tanner in 1981. She is probably remembered most for her role as Trixie in seven episodes of Acorn Antiques (1985-1986), an integral part of Victoria Wood: As Seen on TV (1985).
biography.name: Rosie Collins

biography.bio: Chuck Julian is an actor, known for Snatch (2000), Superman (1978) and The War Lover (1962).
biography.name: Chuck Julian

biography.bio: Elaine Ives-Cameron was born on December 5, 1938 in the USA. She was an actress, known for The Message (1976), Agatha Christie's Miss Marple: A Murder Is Announced (1985) and Supergirl (1984). She died on November 15, 2006 in the UK.
biography.name: Elaine Ives-Cameron

biography.bio: Patti Love was born in 1947 in the UK. She is an actress, known for The Long Good Friday (1980), Escape from Sobibor (1987) and Mrs Henderson Presents (2005).
biography.name: Patti Love

biography.bio: Mary Maude is an actress, known for The House That Screamed (1970), Freewheelers (1968) and Crucible of Terror (1971).
biography.name: Mary Maude

biography.bio: William Russell was born William Russell Enoch on 19 November 1924, in Sunderland, County Durham, England, to Eva Compston (Pile) and Alfred James Enoch. He became interested in acting at an early age. He was involved in organizing entertainments during his national service in the Royal Air Force and then, after university, went into repertory theatre. He appeared in "Hamlet" in London's West End and won a number of film roles, usually as a dashing hero. Notable TV work followed in The Adventures of Sir Lancelot (1956) for ITV and Nicholas Nickleby (1957) and David Copperfield in Fredric March Presents Tales from Dickens (1958) for the BBC, shortly after which he was cast as Ian Chesterton in Doctor Who (1963). He later continued a successful acting career, particularly in the theatre, and for a time held a senior post in the actor's union, Equity. In recent years he has been a member of the Royal Shakespeare Company. His son is actor Alfred Enoch.
biography.name: William Russell

biography.bio: Peter Craze was born on August 27, 1946. He is an actor, known for Blade of Darkness (2001), Terror (1978) and If There Weren't Any Blacks You'd Have to Invent Them (1968). He has been married to Illona Linthwaite since 1972. They have one child.
biography.name: Peter Craze

biography.bio: Peter Attard was born in April 1944 in Berkhamstead, Hertfordshire, England. He is an actor, known for To Sir, with Love (1967), Terror (1978) and The Ragman's Daughter (1972).
biography.name: Peter Attard
